tatami.simulation

Interface PlatformLoader

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultPlatform, JadePlatformLoader, LocalDeploymentPlatform

    public interface PlatformLoader
    The platform loader is the interface to the manager of an agent platform. It can load and manage agents. Agents are loaded based on AgentCreationData instances.

    The platform should not contain initializations in its constructor. Creating a new instance of the platform loader should never generate any errors. The platform should be initialized inside the start() method.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  PlatformLoader.PlatformLink
      This interface should be implemented by classes facilitating the link between an agent and a platform (e.g.
      static class  PlatformLoader.StandardPlatformType
      Standard types of platforms.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        the name of the platform loader, as used in the scenario file.

      • setConfig

        PlatformLoader setConfig(net.xqhs.util.XML.XMLTree.XMLNode configuration,
                       BootSettingsManager settings)
        Configures the platform by passing the XML node in the scenario. The platform can extract the necessary settings.

        The method should not perform any initializations that can fail. These should be done in the start() method.

        Parameters:
        configuration - - the XML node containing the configuration of the platform.
        settings - - general application settings specified in the scenario file, program argumetns, etc.
        Returns:
        the instance itself.

      • start

        boolean start()
        Starts the agent platform.
        Returns:
        true if the platform was started successfully; false otherwise.

      • stop

        boolean stop()
        Stops the agent platform.
        Returns:
        true if the platform was stopped successfully; false otherwise.

      • addContainer

        boolean addContainer(java.lang.String containerName)
        Creates a new container, on this platform, on this machine.
        Parameters:
        containerName - - the name of the container to create.
        Returns:
        true if the container was created successfully.

      • loadAgent

        boolean loadAgent(java.lang.String containerName,
                AgentManager agentManager)
        Loads the agent onto the platform. It also calls the method AgentManager#setPlatformLink(PlatformLink) to create a link from the agent to the platform. The platform link may be the platform itself or an agent wrapper, depending on the specific platform.

        The method must guarantee that when it returns, the agent can be started immediately.

        Parameters:
        containerName - - the name of the container in which to create the agent.
        agentManager - - the AgentManager handling the agent's lifecycle.
        Returns:
        true if the operation is successful (meaning a subsequent call to AgentManager.start() should be able to start the agent.

      • getRecommendedComponentClass

        java.lang.String getRecommendedComponentClass(AgentComponent.AgentComponentName componentName)
        Retrieves the name of the class for a component implementation that is recommended by the platform, for the specified component name, if any. If no such recommendation exists, null will be returned.

        This is especially appropriate for components that depend strongly on the platform, such as messaging and mobility. Using this method, agents can be easily implemented by adding the recommended components of the platform.

        TODO: use this, if any, for the agent components, instead of the component-specified implementation.

        Parameters:
        componentName - - the type/name of the component to be recommended.
        Returns:
        the name of the class of the recommended implementation.
